name: ai-first-programming
description: A companion extension for the AI First Programming book series that provides easy access to book examples, prompts, and code responses. Includes a Language Model Chat Provider that returns exact code examples from the books.

commands.title: Focus on AI First Books Panel

walkthroughs.title: Get Started with AI First Programming
walkthroughs.description: Learn how to use this extension as your companion for the AI First Programming book series

steps.title: Enable AI First Book Examples
steps.description:
Before you can use the AI First Book Examples model in VS Code's chat, you need to enable and select it.

**Instructions:**
1. Click the button below to copy the command and open the Command Palette
2. Paste the command (Ctrl+V / Cmd+V) and press Enter
3. Find "AI First Book Examples" in the Manage Models interface
4. Enable the model by toggling it on
5. Select it as your active model

[Copy Command & Open Command Palette](command:ai-first-programming.copyManageModelsCommand)

steps.title: Explore the Book Content
steps.description:
Open the AI First Books panel and navigate to the section for the language and book you are reading. The content is organized by book, section, chapter, and example.

[Open AI First Books Panel](command:ai-first-programming.focus)

steps.title: Open an Example
steps.description: Navigate through the sections and chapters in the tree view. Click on any example to view the detailed prompt and code response with syntax highlighting.

steps.title: Copy the Example Code
steps.description:
Copy the prompt from the example so you can use it to generate code.

**Instructions:**
1. Click the "Copy Prompt" button in the example view
2. The button will show "âœ“ Copied!" to confirm the prompt is in your clipboard
3. Open a new editor with `Ctrl+N` (or `Cmd+N` on Mac) to prepare for pasting the prompt

steps.title: Use with GitHub Copilot Chat
steps.description:
Use GitHub Copilot Chat to generate code using the prompts from the AI First Programming books.

**Instructions:**
1. Invoke GitHub Copilot Chat with `Ctrl+Shift+I` (or `Cmd+Shift+I` on Mac)
2. Paste the copied prompt with `Ctrl+V` (or `Cmd+V` on Mac)
3. Send the prompt to generate code

**Note:** Make sure to switch to the AI First Book Examples model in the chat interface. You only need to do this once - it will remain selected for future chats.

scripts.pretest: npm run compile && npm run lint
